meanings.definition: A man of good social standing and behavior.
meanings.sent1: The gentlemen gathered at the country club for a round of golf.
meanings.sent2: The store clerk greeted the gentlemen with a warm smile.
meanings.sent3: The gentlemen politely argued over who should pay the bill.
meanings.sent4: He was a true gentleman, always holding the door open for others.
meanings.sent5: In the old movie, the gentlemen wore top hats and tails to the ball.

meanings.definition: A polite or formal way of addressing a man.
meanings.sent1: Excuse me, gentlemen, may I have your attention, please?
meanings.sent2: The hostess addressed the guests as gentlemen and ladies.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled when their friend jokingly called them gentlemen.
meanings.sent4: As the teacher entered the room, she said, 'Good morning, gentlemen.'
meanings.sent5: The announcer on the train welcomed the passengers with, 'Good evening, gentlemen.'

meanings.sent1: The gentlemen at the charity event generously donated to the cause.
meanings.sent2: In the story, the knight was known as a true gentleman of the realm.
meanings.sent3: The gentlemen in the novel always put others' needs before their own.
meanings.sent4: She admired his courage and considered him a true gentleman.
meanings.sent5: The gentlemen of the court were respected for their noble deeds.
